ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend, because you learn not only the findings in the literature and the tools of the trade, but also learn how to critically evaluate the claims and their applicability to the real world.

I would recommend MGMT 758 to a student who has NO background in behavioral economics. For someone who has taken classes in BE before, it can be a bit repetitive. However, the lectures are engaging and fun, and the material is interesting. Warning: The grading is a bit hard to get a handle on, as there are very few graded assignments, and they are not returned until it is far too late to use them to improve. They are graded very harshly, without too much feedback. I do not know how I did on the final project (not having yet seen my grade), but it is hard to tell how you are doing in the class until it is over.
An introduction to the core concepts of behavioral economics and the seminal studies that launched the field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
